thread.title: Illinois gun-rights group to game Chicago gun buyback effort
thread.title_full: Illinois gun-rights group to game Chicago gun buyback effort

title: Illinois gun-rights group to game Chicago gun buyback effort
text:
Illinois gun-rights group to game $250,000 gun buyback effort announced by Chicago mayor 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 10/20/15 4:46 am EDT - Updated: 10/20/15 4:46 am EDT 
CHICAGO â€” An Illinois gun-rights advocate says he will take advantage of an effort by Rahm Emanuel to implement a $250,000 gun buyback program the Chicago mayor says is designed to get illegal guns off the city's streets. 
Champaign-based Guns Save Life executive director John Boch says he and his group "will be delighted to transact business once more with do-gooders in Chicago." 
The Chicago Sun-Times reports ( http://bit.ly/1LzYpWT ) Guns Save Life used Chicago's 2012 gun buyback to embarrass city officials. That year, members said they turned in rusty and inoperable guns. The $100 MasterCard gift cards for each gun were used to buy ammunition for a National Rifle Association youth camp in Bloomington and bolt-action rifles for campers. 
Boch is vowing to return to Chicago with about 60 guns to turn in. 
Information from: Chicago Sun-Times, http://chicago.suntimes.com/
